alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Musselshell; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:34PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Stillwater, southwestern Musselshell, west central Yellowstone and southeastern Golden Valley Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 632 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ryegate to 20 miles northwest of Laurel. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broadview, Lavina, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Acton, Molt and Comanche. Also portions of US-12 from Ryegate east to the Musselshell county line. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding, ponding of water on roadways, and poor visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
